subject: Personal Finance
title: Conspicuous Consumption
description: Learn Conspicuous Consumption in one minute.

hook.text: Veblen noticed in 1899 that the rich don't buy things to use them â€” they buy to be seen.

buildup.text: He coined 'conspicuous consumption': spending specifically to signal status to others.

discovery.text: Luxury brands get this. The logo is the product; the bag is just the delivery system.

twist.text: Middle-income families spend a higher share on visible goods than the wealthy do.

climax.text: Status signaling is most intense where inequality is highest. The gap fuels the display.

punchline.text: You're buying the audience, not the product.
